titlestmt.titleproper: Union League of Philadelphia newspaper clippings 1863-2007
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Union League of Philadelphia newspaper clippings

bioghist.p: The Union League of Philadelphia was founded in 1862 as a patriotic society to support the policies of President Abraham Lincoln. It evolved to its current identity as a non-sectarian and non-partisan private club.

scopecontent.p: Photocopies and some originals of newspaper coverage of the Union League and selected broader Philadelphia concerns. There are also newspaper clippings and newspapers related to particular topics, including the death of President William McKinley.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.
